Please speak your wishes freely and I will do just as you wish. I should prefer to come home, for I want to see you very much. May the Lord bless you abundantly, is my prayer. I hope dear Adelia will be of good courage. I will relieve her soon. I fully appreciate her self-denial and privations for us and 


                                    -28- 

I pray that God will bless her with His free Spirit.--Letter 9, 1865, p. 2. (To James White, November 22, 1865)
